title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 361.0 - Scope
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 361.0 - Scope

State Regulations

This Part requires social services districts, subject to
the appropriation of funds therefor, to establish and implement a case
management system for eligible pregnant, parenting and at-risk adolescent
public assistance recipients, and specifies the case management activities the
social services districts are to perform. The purpose of the case management
system is to help eligible adolescents to maintain and strengthen their family
life and to attain or retain the capability for maximum self-support and
personal independence by assessing the adolescents' needs, providing the
adolescents with information about and referrals to services and assistance
providers which can help the adolescents meet their needs, and monitoring such
referrals. These regulations are required by the Teenage Services Act, chapter
975 of the Laws of 1984. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
361.0

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
